B7aHVuFsSJkc6p-yRa6NBg.text: The food was amazing! The filet mignon and sushi was tasteful as well as their wide selection of sake.

jeKH8D824AcrL_RCuDj6Fg.text: We went here for a dinner for two. The food was good - try the bean ice cream, was great! The scenery looks cool but hard to enjoy as the music was super loud - not that many matrons were there so that might have affected the noise. Don't think we will be going back

tvRy7VpjhxEl10hnbWS0kQ.text: Disappointed. The staff was rude upon arrival. The host clearly was having a bad day or lacked people skills all together. We also waited 10 minutes to be greeted by a server, as everyone one of them walked past us the whole time. We where just about to leave before greeted. Food wasn't good either. Spending what we did for a table of two I expected more. It's sad because we come to charlotte all the time. We Ate here once before and it was perfect.

nfiQLmmzSGgctApga1DR2A.text: Absolutely horrible service. As someone who worked at a restaurant for numerous years, I am usually lenient and understanding. But the service was absolutely horrible. We waited 2 hours for our food. Once it came finally, we waited another hour for our checks (after asking for them immediately). After speaking with a manager, we had to finally go up to the register to check out (30 mins later). We left at midnight. No one ever came to apologize.

FQQP6XO8g2AQmsS4cGaqkw.text: Food was pretty good...not the best by any means. Waitresses were super rude and the service was painfully slow. There are PLENTY of better places to dine in Charlotte.

t_AGmZyUE6yHX9-5Zy0OgQ.text: Good food, tons of fun on the weekend with the live dj and larger-than-life owner. Had a problem with our bill and she was extremely accommodating. Will absolutely be back for the experience alone.

ZgkfZbnWSRgQn8trM1AJeA.text: Not impressed. Service was horrible and I found CHICKEN in my tofu dish. As a vegetarian, I was very upset over this and the staff/Joanna was rude when I pointed it out. NOT going back here again.

iBnlFiA_w6IxFtpNeSHxWQ.text: My boyfriend and I came multiple times and each time it was better than the last! Yes it's loud yes it's crowded most times. But, it's definitely worth the wait. The service is great and the food is even better! I definitely reccomend to come for date night or night our with the girls! No kids at night because it does get pretty loud. Other than that. Great experience! I'd definitely come again.

kClgrwOuTf4AB-_ndLVwvQ.text: Had a great experience here . The cocktails are fantastic . Sushi was good . Service was good .

C0xRAIyNqIWEwbj1xnooww.text: My friends and were planning a girls weekend and I made reservations for 12 at Nikko's a month and a half ago. We ended up needing to push our reservation back and they were very accommodating. Get to the restaurant at 8:45 pm (reservation was at 9), I checked in with the guy at the front and told him we were early, but wanted to check in. He said it would be a few minutes. I told him that was fine as we were 15 minutes early. Five after 9 and they haven't called my name. My friends goes to check and is told 10 minutes. 10 minutes comes and goes, we go check again. We are told that the table they are going to give to us is still seated (they have already paid, but haven't gotten up). About 9:30 I go to follow up again and I'm told the same thing. At this point I'm thinking 1. Either let the table know hey we are extremely crowded tonight and have a long wait, so that they can wrap up their conversation or 2. stop seating these parties of 3 or 4 people who are just walking and start pushing tables together, to accommodate the multiple parties you have waiting . The guy at the front says I can get you a drink on me, well sir there are 11 people in my party and it's not really fair for me to be the only one to get something and not everyone who is waiting, I said what about the rest of my party. He just looked at me and squeezed my arm. At this point I notice that there is another customer who keeps going to the hostess stand as well. I went to ask him what time was his reservation and he tells me his was at 9 for a party of 10 and he keeps getting the same run around. Finally get seated about 9:45 (45 minutes later), get to the table and there aren't enough menus, so we are sharing menus, its another 10 minutes before the waiter actually gets to our table. He finally comes, brings us water, takes our orders. Food comes out and it's even more problems. My friend sitting across from me  ordered one of the same sushi rolls I did but she asked for no mayo. He brings the plate out with my other sushi roll on it, but no mayo on the roll we had a like. He goes did you all switch seats, I said no we didn't. He goes oh ok I'll fix this. I said well just have the roll prepared with everything and I'll just take my other roll from her when it comes out. He brings back the roll still with no mayo. One of my friends asked for the tempura app and got the tempura roll. Another friend wanted shrimp with veggies and got the tempura roll. She told him that wasn't what she asked for, and explained what she wanted. He came back with tempura shrimp and veggies (Still not what she wanted). When the checks came, we were all ready to pay and had our cards/money ready. It took about 20 minutes for him to cash us out. When he came back with our cards and receipts he had the nerve to say gratuity was already included and if we wanted to add extra we could. We could clearly see that gratuity was included when we looked at our bill the first time, and his service nor the service we received at the restaurant was worth what was included, so to basically ask for extra  was an insult. The manager,  nor the owner (who was in the restaurant) apologized for our 45 minute wait or the multiple mix ups that happened with our food. The best part of the night was the live DJ they had.  I will not be going back nor recommending this place to anyone else.

MOi2iNSH3H5gZaUdIfl_6g.text: I should start by saying the food isn't bad. It was actually quite tasty.   I'm giving them 3 stars for 2 reasons:  1. Price was a little high for the quality of the food. We ended up spending over $50 for 2 entrees and and appetizer. We each ordered the teriyaki chicken entree and as I mentioned earlier, it was good. We had the firecracker shrimp for an appetizer and that was delicious but a little over battered.   2. Atmosphere. The place feels like you walked into a some weird fusion between a high end night club where you might find pro athletes and musicians / some type of Asian mafia in the back room.   Staff seemed friendly enough and we didn't have to wait long at all for our food.   I should mention we did not try the sushi which seems to be the route we should have gone after reviewing others comments.

lx5EuDPVYvC-bp5TUfzw7Q.text: Let's cut to the chase.  Parking deck close by and valet option- Yay.  Nigiri is meant to be eaten with your hands. Of course I washed mine before the food came, but no towels at the table? Unheard of.  It's a bit pricey. It is a little loud (we were there on a weeknight- I was told weekends are very very loud). Service was 2 stars. It was a week night, not busy, but our server was not paying attention enough that we needed to remind her she did not bring everything we ordered. Yet, 3 stars is totally warranted if only because the sashimi was so fresh and delicious. (The roll we ordered was some Americanized concoction so I won't hold it against the restaurant.) I'll come back for the sashimi any day.

puF2RFul5nPLuYSzkLaPjg.text: Both of us ordered the $14 Tonkotsu Ramen.  Took 25 minutes for the food to arrive, and the soup was only lukewarm.  Not a good sign already.  Things only went downhill from here.  The noodles weren't Japanese ramen but more like the Korean variety (soft, not curly), and the broth was way too salty.  The pork was ok but the cold soup and wrong type of ramen had ruined it for me.  Seriously this was worse than frozen ramen from a Japanese grocery store.  I know they call themselves a sushi bar and Ramen may not be their specialty, but at this price point I had really expected a whole lot better and won't be returning.

XcLMWeKpHJAWKCe2Fd1wuQ.text: Caught this place at the end of their day. Nice atmosphere and a good feel all-round. The music may have been a little loud considering the place was empty but 90s hip hop is so classic it kind of worked. Tried a few rolls including the Dancing Queen specialty roll. This restaurant is on their sushi game for sure and the rolls were excellent. In all this was a very good experience and would be four stars, but reaches five stars because the service was outstanding

photos.caption: Photo of Nikko Japanese Restaurant & Sushi Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. This is only part of the order .. Lots of guacamole on top of the Dancing Queen specialty roll

AUf72wV_lMy52L1Z8G-GIA.text: No sushi love here anymore. Everyone who lives in South End's pink building just got sued by Nikkos. Boo! charlotteagenda.com/4576...

ABhQShGHlNjBMWGC-2dLXw.text: The food was ok.  The atmosphere was very lively for a younger crowd.  The only real complaint was the snarky little bald guy working the hostess/host stand.  Fortunately the bar and wait staff were better.

AvzR58naKhOqoHH0ZUrjYw.text: This was a long descent from favorite sushi joint to "never again".  I hate to leave negative reviews, but after being a loyal customer for years, even as the food and service declined, my recent visit will be my last.  The sushi quality was unacceptable, and the service was downright rude.  So sad to see service go down hill.  Oh well.  Glad there are plenty of other options.

l1YOwdlKDLnLAc-XYcwtAQ.text: Wasted $92 on dinner smh... an hour for food for a party of 20. Never got updated on food wait time, only got refilled drinks once. Servers seemed lost & confused with our table orders. Cold food. Just terrible.

OUx91xaoapu1bKMUirzroQ.text: I came here for a friends bday dinner and was quite impressed with the mix of a DJ in a Japanese restaurant. I was also impressed with the fact that we had 8pm reservations but the guest of honor didn't arrive until 8:45 and they still held her table ! Other than that, that was the highlight. It was a table of 10 and 2 servers yet they failed to ever be on the same page. One waiter took on side of the tables order, while the other waitress seemed to be no where in sight. Service was extremely slow and the waiters were hard to come around when you needed something as simple as a fork. We had multiple misunderstandings throughout the night which maybe I can attribute to the DJ. Overall the food was pretty good and I would definitely give it another shot with a smaller party.

JR2swi2vH1SkOkuOaXSdtA.text: The food was OK, but I really needed a quiet setting where I could have a conversation during a fine dine. The music was way to loud and I even requested to have it turned down. They did turn it down, but 5 minutes later it was blasting loud again. Too obnoxious for me and will not attend again.

vM0uYrUkRgs4iO9Jay2oGw.text: Great sushi! Even better staff. It's a great place to go for "happy hour" when you want to let your hair down and feel sexy!!! The owner is a little fire cracker be prepared to dance with her on the weekends.

photos.caption: Photo of Nikko Japanese Restaurant & Sushi Bar - Charlotte, NC, United States. Ikura (salmon roe)  Lychee Martini one of my faves!! Half priced martinis on Thursday. Snapchat- POWERFULAPACHE

H0dLXo-EWXhmLXLw7H-jog.text: Best sushi in Charlotte.  Thursday -Saturday always busy but large to accommodate quickly.   The menu on the Specials page are all creations of the amazing owner Joana, and she will make your event fun as well as tasty.

lR3KShSrNx9HPKHN3pIC2Q.text: Awesome rolls and food. Should be noted on Friday nights this place has a DJ and gets very very loud so don't go Friday nights if you are trying to talk to someone !

SKGFjoGyZCsLzYiNTynvhQ.text: Great location on the south end to have dinner with some friends or as a date. Place had various drinks to order and food to eat. A little overpriced but well worth. Customer service is on point and best to reserve in advance for a party larger than 5. Environment well lit and clean. More modernized than most asian restaurants.

jjhzeQAbPwIgAzJcJIOc7g.text: Ru San's has nothing on the volume here...  Ear splitting crappy music, mediocre food and a half hour wait for gyoza.  One visit was more than enough.
